attributes.title: Physical stock verification
attributes.description:
The table below shows the summary of the stock findings

·           The following were the stock findings;

ü  Bread -     -77 loaves

ü  Cumulative variance in polybags was -484 pieces

All other materials had negligible variances.
attributes.recommendation: ·   The management to ensure that observed strong internal controls are adhered to.

value: + We will continue to maintain proper stock controls as observed.
+ Control is ok and will be maintained
+ Physical stock verification on 12.03.25 showed minimal item variations.
Previous

+ A stock take exercise was conducted on 15.03.25 to assess the effectiveness of internal controls that are put in place to safeguard company assets such as the production materials and the finished products.
+ Minimal variances noted in stock items is an indication that stock controls are being observed.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring strong internal controls and full accountability of company items.

attributes.title: Packed bread weight analysis.
attributes.description:
·      Bread weights were sampled on 15/03/2025.

+ High overweight bread rate was noted.

+ The table below bread weight analysis:
attributes.recommendation:
+ Standard set dough dividing weights should be adhered to in order to ensure production of standard weight bread.

 +  Review of bread yields (for 800g white bread) should be done to address high overweight bread rate.

value:
+ Underweight bread noted will continue to be addressed.

+ Overweight bread for 800g bread resulted from low moisture loss especially that produced during 2nd shift due to prevailing environmental temperatures.

+ We will address underweight bread noted.

+ Overweight bread for 800g bread was due to low moisture loss.
+ Bread weights sampled on 12.02.25 showed high underweight bread rate.
Previous
+ Sample varieties of packed bread were randomly picked and weighed to establish whether the branch adheres to weights and measures standards.

·     Under and overweight bread presence suggests inconsistency in dough dividing.

·    Presence of underweight bread exposes the company to risks of fines and penalties from regulatory bodies.

+    Overweight bread lowers yield targets hence withholding revenues.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring production of standard weight bread.

attributes.title: Bread damages analysis.
attributes.description:
+ production and market damages were analyzed from 01.02.25 - 28.02.25.

+ Bread damages were within the allowable rate as tabulized below;

PRODUCTION DAMAGE ANALYSIS:

·          Production damage rate is tabulated below.

MARKET DAMAGE ANALYSIS:

·          Market damage rate is tabulated below.
attributes.recommendation: + Proper baking processes will ensure that damages are fully checked.
attributes.effect: + Controlled  damages ensures realization of revenue targets.

value: + We will put more efforts to ensure that bread damages are further reduced.
+ Bread damages will further be controlled to minimal levels.
+ February 2025 audit report highlighted that bread damages were within the allowable rate as analyzed from 01.01.25 - 31.01.25.
Previous

+ The test was conducted to determine the extent of damages produced during production and those replaced as market damages and find out if they were within expected/set limits. High damages suggest bread of inferior quality produced.
+ Having controlled bread damages implies that revenue targets were realized.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring production of quality bread to minimize bread damages.

attributes.title: Mixing charts/summaries analysis.
attributes.description:
+ Mixing charts and summaries were analyzed from 01.02.25 - 28.02.25, to determine if quantities indicated were accurate and were also accurately posted on SAP system.

Below are the summary of the findings

·          The above table shows that;

·          There was no significant variance between system and the actual material consumption.

Correct posting was also noted over the audited period.
attributes.recommendation: + The branch should continue observing the set consumption and production standards.

value: + This is noted and will be maintained.
+ Data accuracy will always be ensured with actual consumptions being reflected on production records.
+ February 2025 audit report highlighted that mixing chart data was accurate and was accurately transferred to mixing chart summaries and correctly posted on the SAP system.
Previous
·          Comparison of manual mixing charts and the system mixing charts was done from 01.02.25 – 28.02.25 to find out if accurate transfer of production data was being done.
+ Consumption and production set standards were observed and this implies proper accountability of raw materials and finished goods.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring actual mixing chart quantities are accurately transferred to mixing chart summaries and posted on SAP system.

attributes.title: Mini shop spot check.
attributes.description:
·          Mini shop spot check was conducted on 15.03.2025.

·         The shop attendant accounted for all the bread loaded.

·         All sales were made through Mpesa till.

·         The Table below illustrates the transactions;
attributes.recommendation: + The Mini shop attendant should keep up with the good stock and cash control.

value: + Mini shop stock was okay.
+ Controls on mini shop to be maintained.
+ Spot check on 12.02.25 showed proper mini shop controls.
Previous
+ A spot check was conducted in the mini shop to assess whether their operations were being carried out in accordance with the established standards.
+ Minishop SOPs are followed.
Sales Department
+ Ensuring stict adherence to mini shop SOPs.

attributes.title: Bread yield analysis.
attributes.description:
+ Individual bread yield analysis was analyzed and results tabulated.

+ SAP yields matched those of mixing chart summaries.
attributes.recommendation: + Accurate reporting of expected yields is commendable.

value: + Desired yields were realized.
+ Registers and SAP system are verified to ensure accuracy.
+ Expected yields were reported on February audit report as analyzed from 01.02.25 - 28.02.25.
Previous
+ Mixing chart summaries and SAP system were analyzed to assess if expected bread yields were accurately posted.
+ Accurate posting of bread yields assures of accountability of bread produced.
Operations/Production Department

+ To ensure production and accurate posting of set yields.

+ Ensuring actual bread produced is that expected and is accounted for.

attributes.title: Production efficiency analysis.
attributes.description:
+ Analysis was done from 01/02/2025 - 28/02/2025. Production efficiency is tabulated below;

+ Set production efficiency was realized.
attributes.recommendation: + Noted adherence to set production efficiency is commendable.

value: + Production efficiency was at par with that set.
+ We will ensure that set production efficiency is achieved always.
+ February audit report highlighted production inefficiency as analyzed from 01.01.25 - 31.01.25.
Previous
·          This test was conducted to determine if set production  efficiency was adhered to. Low efficiency would indicate increased production costs.
+ Set standard production efficiency was realized and this checks production costs.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring production efficiency targets are realized.

attributes.title: Packing efficiency analysis.
attributes.description:
+ Packing efficiency analysed (01.02.25 - 28.02.25) showed set efficiency was not realized.

PACKING EFFICIENCY ANALYSIS:

·          Packing efficiency (01/02/2025 – 28/02/25) is tabulated below;
attributes.recommendation: ·          Surplus wage payment due to production and packing inefficiency should be surcharged.

value: + Packing efficiency was affected by laborers who are slow. We will however streamline this and ensure efficiencies are as set policies
+ We will put in stringent measures to address operational inefficiencies noted
+ February 2025 audit report highlighted packing inefficiency as analyzed from 01.01.25 - 31.01.25.
Previous
+ This test was conducted to determine if set  packing efficiency was adhered to. Low efficiency would indicate increased production costs.
+ Packing inefficiency increased production costs.
Operations/Production Department
+ To ensure that set packing efficiency is achieved to check production costs.

attributes.title: Motor vehicle fuel consumption analysis.
attributes.description:
+ Fuel analysis was done for the month of February 2025.

+ Fuel consumption for all sales vans was within the allowed range, hence economical fuel consumption was noted.
attributes.recommendation: + Economical fuel consumption for motor vehicles is commendable.

value: + We always ensure that fuel awarded to each van is as per set consumption rate considering the distance covered.
+ Fueling of sales vans is done in line with set policies.
+ February 2025 audit report highlighted sales vans economical fuel consumption as analyzed from 01.01.25 - 31.01.25.
Previous

+ The exercise was carried out to determine if fuel consumption quantities by sales vans  was at par with those provided on the revised permanent file. High fuel consumption would read increased operation costs.
+ Fuel consumption was economical and this checked operation s costs.
Transport/Fleet Department
+ Ensuring sales vans economical fuel consumption.
